result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Solis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesus Solis in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-182 and 15CM-476

11:11 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea/sentencing at this time.

There is a plea agreement.
15CF-182: Defendant is pleading to Count 1.
40 day jail, $500 fine and Defense is free to argue.
15CM-476 is being dismissed and read in.

Atty Redfield concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 15CF-182.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Redfield for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-182: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-182: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CM-476: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield makes sentencing arguments to the Court, requests home monitor.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-182:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 40 Days
Entire sentence may be served on GPS home detention 
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
Huber granted for employment and counseling and child care
Pay a fine of $500 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up payment plan

20 days in which to appeal

$500 sig bond:  Do not possess/consume illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Defendant Jesus Solis in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/ng entered
BTC: $500 sig bond:  Do not possess/consume illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
